meanings.definition: (Latin) I send away, I dismiss, I let go; I give up, I relinquish
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) First-person singular present active indicative of dimittō: I send away, I dismiss, I let go; I give up, I relinquish.
meanings.notes: This is a Latin verb form. It is the first-person singular present active indicative of the verb 'dimittō'.

etymology.value: From Latin 'dimittō' (to send away, dismiss), from 'dis-' (apart, asunder) + 'mittō' (to send).

pronunciation.notes: Pronunciation varies depending on the dialect of Latin.

usage_notes.value: 'Dimitto' is a verb form used in Latin. It is not commonly used in modern English, except in academic or historical contexts when discussing Latin texts.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word and not generally applicable to English readability scales.
